{{Infobox movie quote | name = "Enna Kodumai Saravanan Idhu" | image = | caption = | character = Senthilnathan | actor = [[Prabhu Ganesan]] | creator = [[P. Vasu]] | firstusedin = ''[[Chandramukhi]]'' | alsousedin = | moviequotes = }}
'''Enna Kodumai Saravanan Idhu''' ({{lang-ta|என்ன கொடுமை சரவணன் இது}}; abbreviated to '''EKSI''') is a quote from the 2005 [[Tamil film]] ''[[Chandramukhi]]'' spoken by the character Senthilnathan, played by [[Prabhu Ganesan]]. The line has gained popularity<ref>http://www.hindu.com/fr/2008/09/12/stories/2008091250810100.htm "Prabhu’s penchant for comedy is well known. "I hope I get to play light roles. Incidentally, I quite like the way in which these young actors have made a joke of my serious line in ‘Chandramukhi’ — ‘Enna Kodumai Saravana Idhu.'"</ref> as an expression of irony or surprise.<ref>http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2011-08-31/news-interviews/29948789_1_vazhi-dialogues-popular-culture</ref>
==Origin== In the film, actor [[Prabhu Ganesan]] exclaims this to his friend Saravanan, portrayed by [[Rajinikanth]]. He says this dialogue, when he comes to know that his wife Ganga, played by [[Jyothika]], has an alternate personality called "Chandramukhi".
"Enna Kodumai Saravanan Idhu" literally means "What atrocity is this, Saravanan?" Saravanan, originally a name of the Hindu God [[Kartikeya|Murugan]], is also a frequently used [[personal name]] among [[Tamil people]].
==Other usage== The line, however, gained notable attention and popularity, after being varied slightly to "Enna Kodumai, Sir", used by comedian [[Premji Amaran]] in the comedy film, ''[[Chennai 600028]]'' (2007).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-news-1/oct-09-02/goa-09-10-09.html |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2014-09-26 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140926070233/http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-news-1/oct-09-02/goa-09-10-09.html |archivedate=2014-09-26 |df= }} "It is worth a mention here that the director, in his debut venture Chennai 28, had modified the famous “Enna Kodumai Saravanan” dialogue in Chandramukhi to “Enna Kodumai Sir,” which was well received by the audience."</ref><ref>http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/article/37299.html</ref><ref>http://www.behindwoods.com/features/visitors-1/premji-11-12-08.html</ref> The line is reused by Premji in nearly all his subsequent comedy roles, in films such as ''[[Santosh Subramaniam]]'', ''[[Goa (film)|Goa]]'' and ''[[Mankatha]]''. In the 2007 film ''[[Sivaji (film)|Sivaji: The Boss]]'', actor [[Livingston (actor)|Livingston]] uses the variant "Enna Kodomai Saravanan Sir." Enna Kodumai Saravanan Ithu is also abbreviated to "EKSI" in chat and [[SMS language]].
==See also== * [[Chat language]] * [[Text messaging]]
==References== {{reflist}}
[[Category:Quotations from film and television]]

{{Infobox comic book title | title = Fatale | image = Fatale_001_Cover_by_Sean_Phillips.jpg | imagesize = | caption = Cover for Issue #1 of ''Fatale'' by [[Sean Phillips]]. | schedule = Monthly | format = [[Limited series (comics)|Limited series]] | limited = | ongoing = y | 1shot = |Crime = y | publisher = [[Image Comics]] | date = | startmo = January | startyr = 2012 | endmo = July | endyr = 2014 | issues = 24 | main_char_team = | issn = | writers = [[Ed Brubaker]] | artists = [[Sean Phillips]] | pencillers = | inkers = | letterers = | colorists = [[Dave Stewart (artist)|David Stewart]] | editors = | creative_team_month = | creative_team_year = | creators = Ed Brubaker
Sean Phillips | TPB = Death Chases Me | ISBN = 1607065630 | TPB1 = The Devil's Business | ISBN1 = 1607066181 | TPB2 = West of Hell | ISBN2 = 1607067439 | TPB3 = Pray for Rain | ISBN3 = 1607068354 | TPB4 = Curse the Demon | ISBN4 = 1632150077 | subcat = | altcat = | sort = Fatale (Image comics) | addpubcat# = | nonUS = }} '''''Fatale''''' is a supernatural [[Crime fiction|noir]] [[comic book]] created by [[Ed Brubaker]] and [[Sean Phillips]]. It was published by [[Image Comics]] between January [[2012 in comics|2012]] and July 2014. The series was initially announced as a 12-issue [[limited series (comics)|limited series]], but it was later extended to 24 issues. ==Publication history== The series was originally announced in the back of the final issue of Brubaker and Phillips' previous collaboration, ''[[Criminal (comics)|Criminal]]: [[List of Criminal story arcs#The Last of the Innocent|Last of the Innocent]]''.''Criminal'' vol 4 #4 Further details about the series, including its publisher, were revealed at the [[2011 in comics|2011]] [[New York Comic Con]].Harper, David, [http://multiversitycomics.com/news/nycc-updated-brubaker-phillips-roll-out-fatale-at-image/ NYCC Updated Brubaker Phillips roll out Fatale at Image], [[Multiversity Comics]], 14 October 2011, retrieved 26 June 2012 Brubaker also released a video teaser for the series.Harper, David, "[http://multiversitycomics.com/news/nycc-the-trailer-to-brubaker-and-phillips-fatale-revealed/ NYCC: The Trailer to Brubaker and Phillips’ "Fatale" Revealed] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151124105416/http://multiversitycomics.com/news/nycc-the-trailer-to-brubaker-and-phillips-fatale-revealed/ |date=November 24, 2015 }}", Multiversity Comics, 15 October 2011, retrieved 26 June 2012 The series began publishing monthly in January 2012. Although initially billed as a twelve-issue series, the length was increased in November 2012.Brothers, David, "[http://www.comicsalliance.com/2012/11/01/the-ed-brubaker-captain-america-exit-interview-marvel-fatale-image/ The Ed Brubaker 'Captain America' Exit Interview] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121104065004/http://www.comicsalliance.com/2012/11/01/the-ed-brubaker-captain-america-exit-interview-marvel-fatale-image |date=2012-11-04 }}", [[Comics Alliance]] 01 November 2012 The series concluded after 24 issues.Ching, Albert [http://www.comicbookresources.com/?page=article&id=50171 IMAGE EXPO: Keynote Announces New Series From Snyder, Morrison, Remender & More], ''Comic Book Resources'', 9 January 2014 Several issues featured an article written by [[Jess Nevins]] and others on the crime/noir characters, both fictional and real. ==Plot== ''Fatale'' chronicles the life of Josephine, or "Jo", an archetypal [[femme fatale]] who is seemingly immortal, having survived from the 1930s to the modern day unaged, and also has a supernatural ability to hypnotize men into becoming intensely infatuated with her, whether she wants them to be or not. Through the decades, Jo struggles to understand and control her powers while being pursued by a violent cult. The cult worships cosmic gods reminiscent of [[Cthulhu Mythos|Lovecraftian horrors]], which are somehow tied to Jo. During her travels, Jo also encounters many men who quickly become entranced by her, often to fanatical degrees. They become entangled in her escapades, possibly as guardians, collaborators, and lovers. A motif of the series is how these men pay dearly for becoming involved with Jo. The narrative jumps back and forth between different time periods and points of view, primarily Jo and the men entranced by her. The majority of the action in the first story arc takes place in the 1950s, the second in the 1970s, the third during the 1930s and [[World War II]], while the fourth arc is set in the 1990s. A couple of issues featured stand-alone stories focused on "fatales" before Jo. Issue #12 tells the story of Mathilda in 13th century France, while Issue #13 tells the story of "Black" Bonnie in the [[Wild West]]. Aside from her powers, both women also shared striking physical similarities with Jo and found themselves pursued by the same cult. ==Collected editions== {{Comics TPB table| {{Comics TPB line|1|Death Chases Me|Image Comics|2012||''Fatale'' #1-5|||}} {{Comics TPB line|2|The Devil's Business|Image Comics|2013||''Fatale'' #6-10|||}} {{Comics TPB line|3|West of Hell|Image Comics|2013||''Fatale'' #11-14|||}} {{Comics TPB line|4|Pray for Rain|Image Comics|2014||''Fatale'' #15-19|||}} {{Comics TPB line|5|Curse the Demon|Image Comics|2014||''Fatale'' #20-24|||}} }} The first ten issues were also collected into a deluxe hardcover edition, it includes behind-the-scenes art and stories, sketches and layouts, back page illustrations, and several of Jess Nevins' historical essays. A second hardcover collected issues 11-24. ==Critical reception== The first issue sold well enough to return to press four times.[http://comicbook.com/blog/2012/04/09/ed-brubakers-fatale-1-gets-a-fifth-printing Ed Brubaker's ''Fatale'' gets a fifth printing], ComicBook.com Reviews for the series were mostly positive with comparisons to the creative team's previous work on ''[[Sleeper (comics)|Sleeper]]'', ''[[Criminal (comics)|Criminal]]'', and ''[[Incognito (comics)|Incognito]]''.Richardson, Walt, [http://multiversitycomics.com/reviews/review-fatale-1/ Review: Fatale #1] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131204192332/http://multiversitycomics.com/reviews/review-fatale-1/ |date=December 4, 2013 }}, Multiversity Comics, 5 January 2012, retrieved 26 June 2012[http://www.comicbookresources.com/?page=user_review&id=4324 Fatale #1 review], [[Comic Book Resources]], retrieved 26 June 2012[http://www.comicsalliance.com/2012/01/04/fatale-comic-review/ Fatale Mixes Crime and Horror in a Monstrously Good Comic] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120712013121/http://www.comicsalliance.com/2012/01/04/fatale-comic-review/ |date=2012-07-12 }}, Comics Alliance Ed Brubaker and Sean Phillips received multiple [[Eisner Awards]] nominations for ''Fatale'' in 2013: "Best Continuing Series" (Brubaker and Phillips), "Best New Series" (Brubaker and Phillips), "Best Writer" (Brubaker), "Best Penciller/Inker" (Phillips), and "Best Cover Artist" (Phillips).{{cite web|title=Will Eisner Comic Industry Award Nominees 2013 |url=http://www.comic-con.org/awards/will-eisner-comic-industry-award-nominees-2013 |work=San Diego ComicCon International |accessdate=1 December 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131204081131/http://www.comic-con.org/awards/will-eisner-comic-industry-award-nominees-2013 |archivedate=4 December 2013 |df= }} David Stewart received a 2013 Eisner award for "Best Coloring".{{cite web|last=Newsarama Staff|title=2013 EISNER Awards Winners (Full List)|url=http://www.newsarama.com/18436-2013-eisner-awards-winners-full-list.html|work=Newsarama|accessdate=1 December 2013}} ==References== {{reflist}} {{Ed Brubaker}} [[Category:Image Comics titles]] [[Category:2012 comics debuts]] [[Category:Crime comics]] [[Category:Horror comics]] [[Category:Comics by Ed Brubaker]]

{{more citations needed|date=March 2010}} {{Infobox video game | title = Forever Kingdom | image = Forever Kingdom.jpg | image_size = 256px | developer = [[FromSoftware]] | publisher = {{vgrelease|JP|FromSoftware|NA|[[Agetec]]}} | director = Yuzo Kojima | producer = Masanori Takeuchi | artist = Junichiro Ishino
Ken Sugawara | writer = Mie Takase | composer = [[Kota Hoshino]] | released = {{vgrelease|JP|June 21, 2001{{cite web| title=エヴァーグレイス２（EVERGRACE II）| url=http://www.fromsoftware.jp/top/soft/eg2/index.html | work=FromSoftware.jp | language=Japanese | accessdate=2009-04-11}}|NA|January 22, 2002{{cite web| author=IGN staff | date=January 22, 2002 | title=IGN: Forever Kingdom Ships Today | url=http://ps2.ign.com/articles/101/101137p1.html | work=IGN.com | accessdate=2009-04-11}}}} | genre = [[Action role-playing game|Action role-playing]] | modes = [[Single-player]] | platforms = [[PlayStation 2]] }} '''''Forever Kingdom''''', known in Japan as {{nihongo|'''''Evergrace II'''''|エヴァーグレイス|Evāgureisu Tsu}}, is an [[action role-playing game]] released for the [[PlayStation 2]] by [[FromSoftware]]. It is the prequel to ''[[Evergrace]]''. ==Story== ''Forever Kingdom'' takes place directly before the events of ''Evergrace''. Darius lived a somewhat sheltered life with his parents in the small village of Solta. Though not having any siblings, Darius was very close to his friend Sharline, whom he cared for like a sister. However, Darius' simple home life in Solta would come to a tragic end when assassins hired by the secluded village of Morea murdered Darius' parents for unknown reasons. In addition to facing the loss of his family, Sharline was nowhere to be found, leaving Darius with the conclusion that she was also killed. Shortly after the tragedy, Darius sought refuge with his childhood friend, Ruyan, from the village of Seclue. Ruyan's father agreed to take Darius under his wing, as well as training him in swordplay so that he might one day take vengeance against his adversaries. As time passed, Darius and Ruyan tirelessly trained together, eventually forming "The Four Swordsmen of Solta" with two other mentionable warriors, Drumhort and Saris. Once prepared for his journey, Darius left Seclue in search of some answers into his parents' murder, as well as the disappearance of Sharline. Ruyan, being close to Darius, also decided to come along in hopes of aiding Darius in realizing his revenge. Though they travelled far abroad the continent of Edinbury, Darius and Ruyan's efforts had proven daunting. Just when they were about to give up all hope, however, the two suddenly stumbled upon an unconscious girl, who later claimed to suffer from amnesia. She could only recall her name—Faeana. Having nowhere else to go, Faeana decided to tag along with Darius and Ruyan, hoping that she might recognize someone or something along their journey. ===The Eve of Disaster=== A year or so ago, as Darius and Ruyan were on their journey, a great 'cataclysm' had taken place, believed to be a war between Rieubane and another political power. The war generally affected much of Edinbury and its people, causing somewhat of a great depression. Though the political affairs of Rieubane—as well as the cause of the war—yet remain unknown, Faeana is believed to have some strange involvement in the Eve of Disaster. However, she herself cannot recall the events. ===Solca, Darsul, and the Soul Bind=== Along their travels, Darius and co. happen upon a mysterious girl named Solca. Before any acquaintances can be made, however, a dark wizard named Darsul and his clad guardian appear to abduct the girl, making quick work of Darius and his party. Before vanishing into thin-air with Solca, however, Darsul places a curse known as the 'Soul Bind' on Darius and his friends. It is later discovered that the 'Soul Bind' is a powerful spell which links the lifeforce of those afflicted, causing them to share the same experiences through a form of empathy. Baring this in mind, the three have no choice but to temporarily set aside their affairs and seek a cure, lest they otherwise perish together. ==Characters== '''Darius''' - A young swordsman from the village of Solta. His parents were murdered as a child, and his childhood friend Sharline was abducted, as well. He spent the rest of his childhood with his friend Ruyan, training to become one of "The Four Swordsmen of Solta." He has somewhat of a reserve about him, which often intimidates others. However, Darius has a genuine heart, and ultimately wishes to help those in need of his abilities. '''Ruyan''' - A close childhood friend of Darius. Having much sympathy toward Darius' tragic past, Ruyan trains himself as a skilled swordsman so that he may fight by Darius' side and bring an end to the Eve of Disaster. Ruyan is a very warm-hearted young man whose kind ethos prevents him from intently harming another. However, no cost—whether it be bloodshed or otherwise—is too great to achieve peace. '''Faeana''' - An amnesiac young girl who was discovered unconscious by Darius and Ruyan on their travels. Having felt a warm presence about them, she travels at their side, hoping that she might recognize something along the way, or perhaps otherwise recall her memory. '''Darsul''' - A rather shady wizard who has some interest in a girl named Solca. Upon running into Darius and his party, Darsul inflicts them with the Soul Bind, and abducts Sulca without much revealing much of his reasoning. '''Drumhort''' - A clad swordsman currently travelling with Darsul for unknown reasons. He also aids in the abduction of Solca. '''Solca''' - A mysterious young girl who was being pursued by Darsul and Drumhort. Before her abduction, Darius and co. had shortly run into Solca, causing Faeana to experience strange feelings. Perhaps she and Faeana have some connection, though details are yet unknown. '''Karmyla''' - A dark woman with a very gothic-appearance who later accompanies Darsul, aiding him with much great wisdom. However, her intentions with Darsul otherwise remain shadowed from Darius and his party. '''Felk''' - Currently leading the Solta army, Felk spends most of his time searching for his lost half-brother. He is usually accompanied by a swordsman named Saris. '''Saris''' - A nomadic mercenary foreign to Edinbury. He often accompanies Felk, serving as his right-hand man. ==Gameplay== ===The Soul Bind=== The Soul Bind is a curse placed on Darius and his party which causes them to share the same lifeforce. Thus, if a member of Darius' party is attacked, then they all endure damage. Consequently, healing one character also heals the other two, as well. Generally, a 'Soul' gauge measures the overall lifeforce of the party, which is displayed at the bottom-left corner of the screen. When damage is taken by any of the three player-characters, the gauge decreases. If the gauge is completely depleted, then the entire party perishes simultaneously. While proving to be somewhat frustrating, the game features an option which allows Life Extracts (healing potions) to be used at the press of the button, removing some of the challenge of managing three characters who share one life gauge. ===Character Growth=== Rather than implementing a level-up system like most RPGs, Forever Kingdom utilizes character growth through equipment upgrading. Each item either raises or lowers attributes respectively, and may be tampered with at shops to increase this effectivity. Though very cost-heavy, character growth is seen to be more customizable with this method. ===Battle Mechanics=== :'''Real-Time Combat:''' Forever Kingdom focuses on real-time combat environments between the player, two character allies controlled by AI, and real-time enemies. Since the player may only control one party member at any given time, the other two characters will engage enemies based on a strict AI script. Although, there is no way to customize this based on preference or character build. However, the player may switch between the three characters at any given time, allowing the computer to control the other. :'''Palmira Actions:''' Palmira actions are special skills associated with various equipment found in the game, each having its own set of Palmira. The available actions to a particular character are determined entirely by what that character is currently equipped with. Once the equipment is replaced with something else, the character's Palmira actions are replaced with new ones. Each character has a specific button associated with Palmira usage -- triangle, square and circle. The order may change depending on which character is currently under control of the player. :'''Combos:''' Forever Kingdom also implements a combo system, allowing the player to execute Palmira actions in large multitudes based on timing. When a Palmira action is used by one character, an icon will appear to indicate which button should be pressed to start the combo, though the icon will disappear shortly if the player does not react quickly enough. Once a combo is stringed, two or more characters will simultaneously bombard foes with their equipped actions, resulting in damage bonuses. ==References== {{reflist|2}} ==External links== *[https://web.archive.org/web/20110716145248/http://www.agetec.com/catalog/product_info.php?products_id=92 ''Forever Kingdom'' at Agetec] {{en icon}} *[http://www.fromsoftware.jp/top/soft/eg2/index.html ''Forever Kingdom'' at From Software] {{ja icon}} {{FromSoftware games}} [[Category:Role-playing video games]] [[Category:Action role-playing video games]] [[Category:FromSoftware games]] [[Category:PlayStation 2 games]] [[Category:PlayStation 2-only games]] [[Category:Video game prequels]] [[Category:2001 video games]] [[Category:Amnesia in fiction]] [[Category:Video games developed in Japan]]

A''' game show host '''is an individual who [[management|manages]] a [[game show]], introduces [[contestants]], and asks [[quiz]] [[question]]s to test the knowledge of said contestants.<ref name="autogenerated1">{{cite web|author=Nolan Feeney |url=http://time.com/2878756/alex-trebek-jeopardy-guinness-world-record/ |title=Jepoardy Host Alex Trebek Sets Game Show World Record |publisher=Time.com |date=2014-06-15 |accessdate=2015-10-21}}</ref>
== History == In 1938, [[Freddie Grisewood]] was the first game show host. He directed ''[[Spelling Bee (game show)|Spelling Bee]]'', a fifteen-minute show that was [[broadcast]] in the [[United Kingdom]] over [[radio]] and [[television]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ukgameshows.com/ukgs/Spelling_Bee_%281%29 |title=Spelling Bee (1) |publisher=UKGameshows |date= |accessdate=2015-10-21}}</ref>
== World Records == In June 2014, [[Alex Trebek]] set a new world record for "hosting more episodes of a single television game show than anyone else in TV history".<ref name="autogenerated1"/> [[Bob Barker]] previously held this record, and Trebek predicted that [[Pat Sajak]] is on track to break it.
== See also == * [[List of game show hosts]]
== References == {{reflist|30em}}
[[Category:Game shows]]
{{game-show-stub}}

{{refimprove|date=December 2017}} {{Infobox amusement park | name = Gaslight Village | image = | caption = | resort = [[Lake George (village), New York|Lake George, New York]], [[New York (state)|New York]], [[United States|USA]] | location = | location2 = | location3 = | coordinates = | theme = | homepage = | owner = | general_manager = | operator = | opening_date = {{Start date|df=y|1959}} | closing_date = {{End date|df=y|1989}} | previous_names = | season = | visitors = | area = | rides = | coasters = | water_rides = | slogan = | status = | footnotes = }} '''Gaslight Village''' was a [[Vaudeville]] themed amusement park in [[Lake George (village), New York|Lake George, New York]]. The park was located along [[New York State Route 9N]], [[U.S. Route 9 in New York|U.S. Route 9]] and [[County Route 69 (Warren County, New York)|Warren County Route 69]] (West Brook Road) in the village. It opened in 1959, designed by [[Arto Monaco]] and built by amusement park builder [[Charles Wood (businessman)|Charles Wood]]. The park was approximately 3-4 city blocks in size, and featured some standard amusement rides, (a [[Ferris wheel]], [[merry-go-round]], [[bumper car]]s, [[Tilt a Whirl]], etc.) as well as some unusual rides. The main feature of the park was the Opera House where Vaudeville-style shows, including an Ice Show, melodramas, and a wide variety of stage acts performed all day and until lights-out each evening. The park was closed in 1989. Its site later became the now defunct Lake George Action Park.<ref name=Anderson/>
==Charles R. Wood Park== In December 2010, it was reported that the Lake George Association, Lake George Land Conservancy, and other organizations had acquired the land and were demolishing the site in order return the area to [[wetlands]] to filter water draining into [[Lake George (New York)|Lake George]], at a cost of up to $12 million.<ref name=Anderson>{{cite news|last=Anderson|first=Eric|title=Last flicker for Gaslight Village|url=http://www.timesunion.com/business/article/Last-flicker-for-Gaslight-Village-847694.php|accessdate=26 July 2012|newspaper=[[Times Union (Albany)|Times Union]]|date=1 December 2010}}</ref>
In April 2012, it was announced that the foundation of Gaslight Village's late founder, the Charles R. Wood Foundation, contributed $750,000 towards a $1.8 million nature park, to be called Charles R. Wood Park. Along with offering picnic and recreational space, the area will treat storm water from NY 9N via a [[settling pond]] and a [[constructed wetland]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Putney|first=Chris|title=Former Gaslight Village To Become Charles R. Wood Park|url=http://www.lakegeorge.com/whatsnew/2012/04/gaslight-village-charles-wood-park.html|work=LakeGeorge.com|accessdate=26 July 2012|date=23 April 2012}}</ref>
== See also == {{Portal|Wetlands}} *[[Palisades Amusement Park|Palisades Park]] *[[Action Park]]
== References == {{Reflist}}
==External links== *{{RCDB|6339}} * [http://www.adirondackalmanack.com/2008/01/gaslight-village-lake-george-fun.html Adirondack Almanack entry]

{{Infobox person | honorific_prefix = | name = Josephine Blatt | honorific_suffix = | image = JosephineBlatt-PoliceGazette.jpg | image_upright = | alt = | caption = Josephine Blatt in the ''[[National Police Gazette|Police Gazette]]'' | birth_name = Josephine Schauer | birth_date = {{circa}} 1869 | birth_place = | death_date = {{Death date|1923|09|01}} | death_place = | death_cause = | resting_place = | resting_place_coordinates = | burial_place = | burial_coordinates = | other_names = Minerva | occupation = Strongwoman
Weightlifter
Professional wrestler | years_active = ????-1910 | era = | known_for = First [[Women's World Championship|Women's World Champion]] | home_town = [[Hoboken, New Jersey]] | height = 6 ft 0 in | weight = 230 lb | spouse = Christian Friedrich Wohlfarth, Charles Blatt, Henry Bercaw | children = 4 | mother = | father = | relatives = | family = | awards = | module = {{Infobox professional wrestler | name = Josephine Blatt | birth_name = Josephine Schauer | birth_date = {{circa}} 1869 | birth_place = | death_date = {{Death date|1923|09|01}} | death_place = | death_cause = | spouse = Christian Friedrich Wohlfarth, Charles Blatt, Henry Bercaw | children = | names = Minerva | height = 6 ft 0 in | weight = 230 lb | billed = | trainer = | debut = | retired = 1910 }} | module2 = | module3 = | module4 = | module5 = | module6 = | signature = | signature_size = | signature_alt = | footnotes = }} '''Josephine Schauer Blatt'''{{cite web |url=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/9062868/many_volunteers_forced_into_it/ |title=Many Volunteers Forced Into It |last=Bombeck |first=Erma |authorlink=Erma Bombeck |newspaper=[[Pharos-Tribune|Logansport Pharos-Tribune]] |date=April 29, 1984 |access-date=February 20, 2017}} {{free access}} (''née'' '''Wahlford''') (c.1869 – September 1, 1923), best known by her [[stage name]] '''Minerva''', was a [[strongwoman]]. She married [[Strongman (strength athlete)|strongman]] Charles Blatt in 1888. ==Early life== Nineteenth-century accounts differ as to the place and time of her birth. In an interview in ''The Mirror'' of [[Manchester, New Hampshire]], she claimed to have been born in 1865 in [[Hamburg]], Germany. The ''[[Guinness Book of World Records]]'' listed her as an American, born in 1869, and various accounts place her either in [[Hoboken, New Jersey|Hoboken]] or [[Elizabethtown, New Jersey]] in her youth. ==World weightlifting record dispute== In the July 1937 issue of ''[[Strength & Health]]'' magazine, Rosetta Hoffman made the claim that Minerva had lifted 23 men and a platform, in a 3,564–lb hip-and-harness lift.{{cite news |title=Onstage Competition purpose in question |url=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/9062723/seguin_gazetteenterprise_january_6/ |newspaper=[[Seguin Gazette|Seguin Gazette Enterprise]] |date=January 6, 1985 |page=15 |via=[[Newspapers.com]] |access-date=February 20, 2017}} {{free access}} For several years, the ''Guinness Book of World Records'' listed Minerva as having lifted the greatest weight ever by a woman—3,564-lb in a hip-and-harness lift{{cite web |url=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/9062247/the_kokomo_tribune_august_19_1990_page/ |title=Sports facts |newspaper=[[Kokomo Tribune]] |date=August 19, 1990 |access-date=February 20, 2017}} {{free access}}— "at the Bijou Theatre, Hoboken, N.J., on April 15, 1895."{{cite news |title=Sport Day |url=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/9062325/gettysburg_times_april_15_1982_sport/ |newspaper=[[The Gettysburg Times]] |date=April 15, 1982 |page=14 |via=[[Newspapers.com]] |access-date=February 20, 2017}} {{free access}} Hoffman may be the source for ''Guinness'' record, even though it contradicts, and even enhances, the published claim of the time from the sponsor of the event, the ''[[National Police Gazette]]''. The ''Gazette'', a sensationalist tabloid of the period, claimed she lifted a platform with only 18 men weighing "approximately 3000 pounds". For this feat, the ''Gazette'' awarded Minerva with a solid gold [[loving cup]] on April 29, 1895; this trophy is now lost. ==Wrestling career== Blatt was the first woman to ever hold a professional wrestling championship, the original [[Women's World Championship]], won in the 1890s. In the 1890s she competed across Mexico.{{cite news |title=In Woman's World: The Fair Sex takes An Interest in Athletics |url=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/9041121/josie_wahlford_logansport/ |newspaper=[[Pharos-Tribune|Logansport Pharos-Tribune]] |date=June 18, 1892 |page=14 |via=[[Newspapers.com]] |access-date=February 19, 2017 |quote= There are Fannie Gorman and Josie Wahlford both of whom have won fame in their ?ine not of mere national limit. The latter is now traveling Mexico where she is astonishing the people with her various feats of prowess.}} {{free access}} ==Late life== Blatt retired from performance in 1910, and invested in New Jersey [[real estate]]. She died on September 1, 1923. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [https://web.archive.org/web/20070928094339/http://www.area30.net/M_amazonas/Iriam/Textos/Articulos/Antiguas%20amazonas/Minerva.htm Minerva] at Antiguas Amazonas * {{Citation |last=Todd |first=Jan |title=The Mystery of Minerva |newspaper=Iron Game History |date=April 1990 |url=http://www.la84foundation.org/SportsLibrary/IGH/IGH0102/IGH0102i.pdf}} * {{Citation |last=Roark |first=Joe |title=The Roark Report: Backlifting |newspaper=Iron Game History |date=January 1992 |url=http://www.la84foundation.org/SportsLibrary/IGH/IGH0201/IGH0201d.pdf}} {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Blatt, Josephine}} [[Category:1869 births]] [[Category:Year of birth uncertain]] [[Category:1923 deaths]] [[Category:Strongwomen]] [[Category:Vaudeville performers]] [[Category:American female professional wrestlers]]

{{Infobox video game | title = Just Dance Now | image = [[File:Just Dance Now logo.jpg|180px]] | caption = | series = ''[[Just Dance (video game series)|Just Dance]]'' | developer = [[Massive Entertainment]]
[[Ubisoft Milan]] | publisher = [[Ubisoft]] | genre = [[Music video game|Music]], [[Rhythm game|rhythm]] | modes = [[Single-player video game|Single-player]], [[Multiplayer video game|multiplayer]] | platforms = [[iOS]], [[Android (operating system)|Android]] | released = {{Video game release|NA|{{Start date|2014|9|25}}}} }} '''''Just Dance Now''''' is a video game in the ''[[Just Dance (video game series)|Just Dance]]'' series developed by [[Ubisoft]]. It was released on September 25, 2014, available in both the [[App Store (iOS)|App Store]] and [[Google Play]]. The trailer for the game was revealed at the [[Electronic Entertainment Expo 2014]] on June 9, 2014. Without the purchase of VIP an ad-supported version of the game is available.{{cite web|url=http://gadgets.ndtv.com/apps/news/just-dance-now-releasing-september-25-for-free-on-android-and-ios-594602|title=Just Dance Now Releasing September 25 for Free on Android and iOS|work=NDTV Gadgets360.com}} A few months prior, a beta version was available in the previously mentioned stores for most parts of Europe. ''Just Dance Now'' is intended for people who may not have access to a [[Video game console|console]] to play the original game. The [[Mobile app|app]] version instead uses an internet connection to the Just Dance Now website through either a television, a computer, a laptop, a tablet or a [[Chromecast]]. The device acts as a controller, much like the [[Wiimote]], the Wii's main controller. Multiple players may connect simultaneously, and there is no limit to the number of players allowed.{{cite web|url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2014/06/09/e3-2014-just-dance-now-lets-you-play-using-a-smartphone|title=E3 2014: Just Dance Now Lets You Play Using a Smartphone|author=Brian Albert|date=9 June 2014|work=IGN}} Since the June 2017 update, the game now allows players to play any song that they want for in-game currency instead of the previous model of providing a playlist offering limited free songs. The app offers a library of songs requiring a time-limit VIP pass which can be purchased through the app or coins which are automatically earned overtime or purchased through the app. ==Track listing== The following list are the songs that appeared in the previous ''Just Dance'' games which include:{{cite web |title=Just Dance Now Credits |url=http://justdancenow.com/credits/ |website=Just Dance Now |publisher=Ubisoft Entertainment |accessdate=3 October 2018}} {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center; width:100%;" |- ! scope="col" style="width:150px;" | Song ! scope="col" style="width:150px;" | Artist ! scope="col" style="width:75px;" | Year ! {{Use mdy dates|date=December 2012}} [[File:Aerial Canadas Wonderland May 2011.jpg|250px|thumbnail|right|Aerial view of Canada's Wonderland in 2011, showing most of the park's attractions|alt=View of Canada's Wonderland from an airplane in 2011.]] [[Canada's Wonderland]] is a {{convert|330|acre|ha|adj=on}} [[Amusement park|theme park]] located in [[Vaughan]], [[Ontario]], Canada, a suburb directly north of [[Toronto]]. When Canada's Wonderland first opened in 1981, there were 26 attractions. Today, there are 69, including the attractions inside [[Splash Works]], a [[water park]] adjacent to the main theme park.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.canadaswonderland.com/park-history/park-history |title=Canada's Wonderland History |publisher=Canada's Wonderland |accessdate=November 1, 2012}}</ref> Since the opening of the amusement park, at least one attraction has been added every year except 2009 and 2013.<ref name=timeline>{{cite web|url=http://www.canadaswonderland.com/park-history/timeline |title=Canada's Wonderland Timeline |publisher=Canada's Wonderland |accessdate=April 17, 2014}}</ref> In addition, [[Freestyle (roller coaster)|SkyRider]] closed permanently in 2014; it was the only roller coaster to close in the park's history and was relocated to Italy.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Karstens-Smith|first1=Gemma|title=After 29 years, SkyRider’s ride comes to an end|url=https://www.thestar.com/news/gta/2014/08/07/after_29_years_skyriders_ride_comes_to_an_end.html|accessdate=September 1, 2014|newspaper=The Toronto Star|date=August 7, 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140902022154/http://www.thestar.com/news/gta/2014/08/07/after_29_years_skyriders_ride_comes_to_an_end.html|archivedate=September 2, 2014 }}</ref> SkyHawk, a Sky Roller by [[Gerstlauer|Gerstlauer Rides]], and Flying Eagles from [[Larson International]] opened in 2016. The 2017 additions include Soaring Timbers and Muskoka Plunge and the 2018 additions include Lumberjack and Flying Canoes; Soaring Timbers, Lumberjack, and Flying Canoes are flat rides, while Muskoka Plunge is a water ride.
Up until 1992, Canada's Wonderland did not have a water park. Eleven years after the park opened, Splash Works was constructed in the area surrounding the [[Mighty Canadian Minebuster]].<ref name=timeline /> Original plans and park maps during construction of the park show that the area that is now Splash Works and White Water Canyon was originally planned to be a themed area called "Frontier Canada", a section of the park devoted to the Canadian wilderness.<ref name=brown>{{cite book|title=Memories of Canada's Wonderland|publisher=International Sports Properties (1980)|location=Toronto ON|pages=46–47|editor=Dick Brown, Louis Cauz|accessdate=November 27, 2012|chapter=It's a great beginning but look what's ahead|url=http://www.torontopubliclibrary.ca/detail.jsp?Entt=RDM2433093&R=2433093|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140525200900/http://www.torontopubliclibrary.ca/detail.jsp?Entt=RDM2433093&R=2433093|archivedate=May 25, 2014|df=mdy-all}}</ref><ref name=CWhistory /><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.pcwjunkies.com/pcw/vault/guides/map81s.htm |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080617133856/http://www.pcwjunkies.com/pcw/vault/guides/map81s.htm |archivedate=June 17, 2008 |title=1981 CW Souvenir Map |publisher=PCW Junkies |accessdate=November 2, 2012}}</ref> Although this section was never built, several of the elements that were to be included are now scattered across the park.<ref name=brown />
For safety, Canada's Wonderland uses a ride rating system that classifies the attractions based on the intensity of the ride. The ratings vary from 1, for rides that are calm and gentle, to 5, for rides that have high speeds, aggressive forces, and rapid elevation changes. A separate set of ride ratings criteria is used for attractions inside Splash Works, though the rides are still rated on a scale from 1 to 5.<ref name=Rating>{{cite web |url=https://www.canadaswonderland.com/images/uploads/file/2015_GuestAssistanceGuide.pdf |title=Canada's Wonderland 2015 Guest Assistant Guide |format=PDF |publisher=Canada's Wonderland |accessdate=May 5, 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304115137/https://www.canadaswonderland.com/images/uploads/file/2015_GuestAssistanceGuide.pdf |archivedate=March 4, 2016 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>

==Splash Works== [[File:Canada's Wonderland (6176388683).jpg|thumb|The amusement park is also home to [[Splash Works]], a water park with a number of rides and attractions.]] Splash Works opened in 1992, eleven years after Canada's Wonderland opened.<ref name=timeline /> Four years later, Canada's Wonderland expanded the water park by adding Whitewater Bay (a wave pool), The Pump House (an interactive children's playground), and The Black Hole (an enclosed water slide).<ref name=timeline /> There were two more expansions in 1999 and 2002.<ref name=CWhistory>{{cite web|url=http://www.cwmania.com/timeline.php |title=Historical Timeline of Canada's Wonderland |publisher=CWMania |accessdate=November 1, 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130103000139/http://www.cwmania.com/timeline.php |archivedate=January 3, 2013 |df= }}</ref> 12 years later, the park announced that Splash Works would receive a new water slide, Typhoon, and an interactive aquatic playground.<ref name=SW2015>{{cite news|title=Canada's Wonderland 2015 Season Passes Now On Sale|url=https://online.wsj.com/article/PR-CO-20140814-905753.html|accessdate=September 1, 2014|publisher=The Wall Street Journal|date=August 14, 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140901210805/http://online.wsj.com/article/PR-CO-20140814-905753.html|archivedate=September 1, 2014}}</ref> In 2017, Muskoka Plunge opened.
